intro: Byttneria obliqua, commonly known as the African wild rubber tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which has been historically used for rubber production. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
